content.description:
there are 2 variations to this problem. they both sit start on small crimps.

The v3 version goes right. The V4 version goes straight up avoiding the holds around the bulge

content.location: Center of the back side of the boulder when looking at it from the street

content.description:
Great little v1 problem. Start in a good side pull and a two finger pocket. Stand up and make the move for the knob.

Beta video:

https://youtu.be/_ndSzlrNPfY
content.location: In the middle of the left face closest to the lake

content.description:
Sit start with your right hand on a good hold and your left in the crack. Bump the left hand and climb up and left to top out. V1 stand start.

Beta Video:

youtube.com/watch?v=dNKgYP9…
content.location: If looking at the boulder from the street it starts close to the back right corner.

content.description:
Sit start on a crimp and a good side pull. Pull up and bump to a left hand jug and a right hand side pull then make you way to the top.

Beta Video:

youtube.com/watch?v=ghlq_x1…
content.location: When looking at  the boulder from the road its close to the back left corner.

content.description: Stand start; Start with your right hand head-high on a full pad crimp and your left hand on an awkward but good, small pinch. Use a shallow sidepull and make a single, big move out left to a good hold. Then, high step and keep a cool head as you go straight up the face with no real good holds. (Don't go left around the arete to the slab).
content.protection: A bi-fold is fine with a good spot (the landing is flat, but there's a tree behind you, and due to the balance high finish, you may peel off left or right)
content.location: This problem starts on the side of the boulder that faces away from the bathroom and the street. (It faces the mountains right behind it and is distinguished by a slight, jutting overhang about chest-high)

content.description: The sit start to Potty Training; Start below the overhang (below the start of Potty Training) on a pair of deep, undercling, two-fingered pockets. Set your feet and make a big pull right out of the overhang to a 3-finger, 1/4 pad edge for your right hand. Move your left hand to the small pinch (the left starting hold of Potty Training), set your feet higher, and make another big, committing pull to the other starting edge of Potty Training. If you haven't blown off, demonstrate your potty prowess and make your way to the top.
content.protection: Same as Potty Training, but have someone move your pad as the line goes left once you're out of the overhang.

content.description:
Sit start in jugs, pull up to seam and top out

Beta Video:

youtube.com/watch?v=eVbx005…

;
content.location: Back left corner of the boulder when looking at it from the road

content.description: Start on a jug ledge about head high, set your right foot, and make a huge move up right to a good jug. (Don't traverse right--that is a V1). Once you've secured it, you can either take the easy exit to the right, or get your blood pumping going up left along the lip.
content.location: The same side as Potty Training.

content.description: This problem is a great warmup. Traverse the north face of the boulder.

Sit Start in good left hand side pull. Climb up and left around the bulge and then rock over onto the slab. Could be considered an eliminate, but this is the most fun way I have found to climb it.

Beta Video:

youtube.com/watch?v=Tqe0XjK…

;
content.location: When looking at the Boulder from the street it is just around the right corner.

content.description: Get a high left foot and perch. Find your balance and mantle and then make your way up the slab with good holds.
content.location: The left side of the face, facing the road
